Weddings & Events
Celebrate Your Special Day in Our Tropical Paradise
In contrast to the rapid pace of the city outside its vine-covered walls, Sunken Gardens offers a tranquil garden atmosphere that creates space for connection, reflection, and community. Sunken Gardens offers a prime location for weddings, private parties, seminars, luncheons, retreats, and receptions hosted by corporations, organizations, or individuals. Events held at the Gardens offer guests a unique experience in a venue that’s conveniently located near hotels, shopping, museums, dining, and entertainment.
Since 1935, Sunken Gardens has been a sought-after setting for exchanging vows. Hundreds of flowering plants, lush tropical displays, and serene waterfalls create a beautiful and tranquil atmosphere in which to say, “I do.”
Garden wedding ceremonies are offered on the historic
Wedding Lawn
,
North Lawn
, or under a canopy of shade trees in the
Oak Pavilion
; celebrations can be hosted in the Garden Room—part of the historic main building.
Visit the
Sunken Gardens Weddings Facebook
to get ideas for your big day.
Daytime Ceremony
Sunday only
10 a.m. - 1 p.m.
Ceremony start time: 11 a.m.
Package Details:
Rehearsal
Chairs
One dressing room
Cost: $2,500
Evening Wedding Packages
Friday, Saturday, Sunday
4:30 - 11:30 p.m.
Gardens & Garden Room Package
Ceremony on North Lawn
Cocktail hour in Oak Pavilion
Reception in Garden Room
Capacity up to 176 Guests
Cost: $7,500
Oak Pavilion Package
Ceremony on North Lawn
Cocktail hour in Palm Plaza
Reception in Oak Pavilion
Capacity up to 72 Guests
Cost: $8,000
Garden Room Reception Package
Access to Oak Pavilion for Cocktail Hour
Reception in Garden Room
Cost: $5,500
Evening Tent Wedding Packages
Friday, Saturday, Sunday
4:30 - 11:30 p.m.
Gardenia Package
Wedding Lawn with 40’x80’ white tent
White chairs, round tables, banquet tables
House lights, dance floor, stage, generator for bands
Capacity up to 200 guests
Cost: $17,500
Royal Palm Package
Wedding Lawn with 40’x80’ white or clear tent
Pole draping options, chair options, round tables, banquet tables
Lights, dance floor, stage, generator for bands
Capacity for up to 200 guests
Cost: $27,500
Contract & Payment
The signed contract, half the rental fee (non-refundable) plus a $250 refundable damage deposit are required to reserve a date. The balance is due 30 days prior to the event. 3% sales tax is applicable on rental. Prices are subject to change. No prices are guaranteed until contract is signed. Holiday rates will apply.
The damage deposit will be retained for any clean-up or damage to the property.
All rental time frames include set-up, the event and clean-up.
Wedding rehearsals are included in the contract and are one hour maximum. Date and time of rehearsal will be arranged in advance by the venue.
Catering & Bar Services
You are required to select from the Sunken Gardens’ approved catering list. Caterers and rental companies must set up and break down within the contracted time. Caterers are required to pay a 15% service charge to Sunken Gardens. The fee is calculated by, and payable to the caterer by the client. No food other than the wedding cake is allowed unless provided by an approved caterer.
Alcoholic beverages must be purchased through Sunken Gardens. Contact 727-892-5715.
Smoking Policy
Smoking is not allowed anywhere in the Gardens, except in designated areas. Smoking is only permitted outside the Garden entry gate.
Parking
Self parking is complimentary in Sunken Gardens parking lot. Valet fees may apply.
Frequently Asked Questions
What is included in the rental?
Space, chairs, and/or tables, parking, dressing room, rehearsal, two day of venue coordinators and one maintenance staff. Linens are not included.
What if I need to cancel or change the date?
Only the damage deposit is refundable.
What is the back up policy for rain?
If you have rented the Garden Room, you may hold the ceremony within the reception set-up.
Are receptions allowed in the Gardens?
Yes, evening outdoor receptions with a tent on the Wedding Lawn are allowed. Weddings with a maximum guest count of 72 guests are allowed in the Oak Pavilion.
Are candles allowed?
Unity candles only are allowed in the Gardens, and candles in glass votives are allowed in the Garden Room. Battery operated candles allowed outdoors.
When may I decorate?
Within the contracted rental time, unless otherwise noted.
Are there any restrictions for decorating?
The following items will not be permitted when decorating the walls, floor, ceiling or stages: bolts, screws, nails, staples, scotch tape, electric tape, duct tape and glue. Crepe paper is not allowed. Glitter is not permitted on tables or floors. Sunken Gardens will not furnish ladders or linens for decorating.
In an effort to preserve the beauty and history of Sunken Gardens, the following items are prohibited at Sunken Gardens:
Bird seed, confetti, fireworks, glitter, rice, sparklers, torches, or any open flames. Any item not listed must be pre-approved by management if being considered.
When can I arrive the day of?
For evening packages arrival can be at 3 p.m. Earlier arrival times must be arranged with Sunken Gardens in advance. Additional fees will apply.
Book Your Wedding OR EVENT
Call 727-551-3106 to book Sunken Gardens for a daytime or evening wedding or event.

About Us
About Sunken Gardens
Nestled in the heart of St. Pete, Sunken Gardens is a lush, tropical oasis home to more than 50,000 exotic tropical plants and birds from around the world, including its iconic flamingo flock.
At more than 100 years old, Sunken Gardens is St. Pete’s oldest living museum.
Learn about Sunken Gardens’ rich history here
.
Sunken Gardens is owned and operated by the
City of St. Peterburg
. The City purchased Sunken Gardens in 1999 with funds from a voter-approved tax. With the original vision in mind, the City works to preserve this historic botanical garden and use it to provide cultural and educational opportunities to the community.

Membership
NOTICE
: Due to the overwhelming support from our members and volume of attendance at special events, new memberships may not be processed or redeemed on special event days.
Support the Gardens
Residents can deepen their roots with Sunken Gardens by becoming a member. Sunken Gardens members receive unlimited annual admission to Sunken Gardens, giving them year-round access to this unique tropical garden experience.
Member Benefits
Members of Sunken Gardens enjoy valuable "members only" benefits and help support new educational opportunities, children's programs, special events, and plant collections.
Unlimited free admission for one year during regular hours
10% discount in the gift shop (on regular-priced items)
Free admission and shop discounts at over 200 reciprocal gardens, arboreta, and conservatories across the United States, Caribbean, and Canada. For a complete list of reciprocal gardens, visit
ahsgardening.org.rap
.
Discounts and priority registration for specified workshops
Access to horticultural resources
Discounts at local attractions
Current Local Reciprocal OFferings
Sunken Gardens members may enjoy reciprocal admission to the following venues during the dates listed below.  It is advised to call ahead to confirm reciprocal benefits are available the day you plan to attend.
Fall 2025:
October - Glazer Children's Museum: Free admission
October - Great Explorations Children's Museum: Free admission (*Note: Great Explorations will be closed every Tuesday during this time).
October - Museum of Science and Industry: Free admission
November - Florida Holocaust Museum: Free admission & 10% off Gift Shop items
November - Imagine Museum: Free admission
November - James Museum: Free admission
Winter 2025:
December - Florida Holocaust Museum: Free admission & 10% off Gift Shop items
ALL YEAR:
Clearwater Marine Aquarium and the Florida Aquarium: Half off for all of 2025
Tampa Bay Watch (Discovery Center at the St. Pete Pier): Free admission for all of 2025
Naples Botanical Garden: 50% off general admission
Membership Rates
Individual Membership: $50
Family Membership: $100 (Includes 2 household family member cardholders with valid ID and children aged 17 and younger. Family Membership holders receive all "members only" benefits listed above.)
Become a Member
Purchase a Sunken Gardens membership by visiting the admissions desk in our lobby. The process takes approximately 15 minutes and will require your photo to be taken by a Sunken Gardens staff member.
Become a Business Partner
In collaboration with the Sunken Gardens Forever Foundation, Sunken Gardens is proud to partner with local businesses who contribute to the preservation and enhancement of the garden experience.
To learn more about Business Partnership Program benefits, tiers, and more, please visit the
Sunken Gardens Forever Foundation website
.
